articles.title: DPRK Premier Gets Familiar with Rakwon Machine Complex and Farm
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Gets Familiar with Rakwon Machine Complex and Farm
						

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim Thursday acquainted himself with the Rakwon Machine Complex and the Sinam Cooperative Farm in Ryongchon County on the spot.
					
					 After going round different places of the complex and the farm, he had consultative meetings with officials concerned.
					
					The meetings discussed measures for pushing forward the work to put production processes on a modern and scientific basis and boost the production of quality machines and increasing the per-hectare grain yield by doing farming on a scientific and technological basis to suit the topographical features, true to the on-the-spot instructions given by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Yong Chun Meets Leading Officers of Chinese Navy Flotilla
articles.content:
Kim Yong Chun Meets Leading Officers of Chinese Navy Flotilla
						

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Kim Yong Chun, vice-chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and minister of the People's Armed Forces, Friday met and had a friendly talk with leading officers of the visiting flotilla of the Navy of the Chinese People's Liberation Army led by Vice Admiral Tian Zhong, commander of the North Sea Fleet of the Navy.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Flotilla
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Flotilla
						

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the flotilla of the Navy of the Chinese People's Liberation Army on a goodwill visit to the DPRK.
					
					 Vice Admiral Tian Zhong, commander of the North Sea Fleet of the CPLA Navy who is leading the flotilla, handed the gift over to Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Kim Yong Chun, vice-chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and minister of the People's Armed Forces, on Friday.

articles.title: Officers of China's Flotilla Visit Birthplace of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Officers of China's Flotilla Visit Birthplace of Kim Il Sung 
						

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- Commanding officers of the flotilla of navy of the Chinese People's Liberation Army headed by Vice Admiral Tian Zhong, commander of the North Sea Fleet of the Navy, visited Mangyongdae, birthplace of President Kim Il Sung, on Friday. The flotilla is on a goodwill visit to the DPRK. 
					
					 Being briefed on the glorious revolutionary history of the President and members of the patriotic and revolutionary Mangyongdae family, the visitors looked round historic relics preserved in state at his old home there. 
					
					 They had a photo session in commemoration of their visit to the old home. 
					
					 Tian Zhong made an entry in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Chinese Seamen Visit Revolutionary Martyrs' Cemetery, Friendship Tower
articles.content:
Chinese Seamen Visit Revolutionary Martyrs' Cemetery, Friendship Tower
						

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- Commanding officers of the visiting flotilla of the Navy of the Chinese People's Liberation Army headed by Vice Admiral Tian Zhong, commander of the North Sea Fleet of the Navy, visited the Revolutionary Martyrs' Cemetery on Mt. Taesong and the Friendship Tower on Friday. 
					
					 They laid bouquets before the bust of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero, at the cemetery. 
					
					 They placed a wreath at the cemetery and paid a silent tribute to the memory of the revolutionary martyrs.
					
					 Then they went to the Friendship Tower to lay a wreath and observe a moment's silence in memory of the martyrs of the Chinese People's Volunteers who bravely fought in the Korean War.

articles.title: Typhoon-9 Likely to Bring Much Rain to DPRK
articles.content:
Typhoon-9 Likely to Bring Much Rain to DPRK 

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- A weather forecast of the DPRK Central Meteorological Research Institute shows that the DPRK will have much rain in some areas between Monday and Tuesday.
					
					 Vice-director of the institute Choe Kwang Guk, told KCNA:
					
					 Typhoon-9, Muifa, located over the sea south of Okinawa, Japan, as of 3 p.m. Friday will head northwest to reach the sea off Zhejiang Province, China, at around 9 a.m. Sunday.
					
					 The typhoon will pass the Shandong peninsula on Monday and get to the northern part of Palhae Bay at around 9 a.m. Tuesday. It will be weakened into extratropical cyclone and move northeast to affect the DPRK.
					
					 The typhoon will bring strong winds of over 10 m/s to western coastal areas and 40-70mm rain to many areas, over 100mm to some areas.
					
					 Between Monday and Wednesday, the West Sea of Korea is likely to see 13-18 m/s southeast winds and 3-5m waves.

articles.title: Flood Damage Gets Serious
articles.content:
Flood Damage Gets Serious

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- The flood caused by heavy rainfalls in late July claimed some 30 lives in the DPRK, according to results of the latest survey. 
					
					Over 6,750 dwelling houses were destroyed in the disaster, leaving more than 15,800 people homeless.
					
					 Over 48,000 hectares of cropland were submerged, buried and washed away in the country, seriously affecting this year's grain output.
					
					 Torrential rains and flood pulled down some 350 production facilities and public buildings and heavily damaged riverbanks, tide embankments and waterways.
					
					 Landslides wrecked railroads and severed bridges and roads extending more than 6,900 meters, making it difficult to supply relief goods and materials to the afflicted areas. 
					
					 The largest victim is South Hwanghae Province.

articles.title: Citations Awarded to Builders of Merit
articles.content:
Citations Awarded to Builders of Merit

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- Commendations were conferred on officials and members of the 618 Construction Shock Brigade who worked feats in building the Kosan Fruit Farm in the DPRK.
					
					 They have turned the farm into a modern fruit production base in a short span of time in the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance and devoted service for the people, thus contributing to the improvement of the people's standard of living.
					
					 The citation of wrist watch bearing the august name of President Kim Il Sung was awarded to O Pong Hwan, director of the Political Department of the Kangwon Provincial Brigade, Choe Yong Chol, head of the North Hwanghae Provincial Brigade, Kim Ok Bun, member of the Pongsan County Battalion, Pyon Hui Chon, platoon leader of the South Hamgyong Provincial Brigade, and others.
					
					The citation of General Secretary Kim Jong Il went to Pae Yong Chol, section chief of the South Phyongan Provincial Brigade, Jon Kwang Sik, company commander of the North Phyongan Provincial Brigade, and others.
					
					 Kim Il Sung Youth Honor Prize was conferred on Choe Sung Chol, first secretary of the 618 Construction Shock Brigade Youth League, Pak Hak Min and Ri Ryong Chol, secretaries of the Kangwon and North Phyongan provincial brigade committees of the 618 Construction Shock Brigade Youth League, and Kim Hak Chol and Choe Chol Jin, members of the Hungnam district and Kilju county battalions.
					
					 Also the Order of National Flag First Class went to 53 persons, the Order of Labor to 43 and other orders and medals to many officials and members of the shock brigade.

articles.title: Pyongyang Proves Successful in Consumer Goods Output
articles.content:
Pyongyang Proves Successful in Consumer Goods Output
						

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang City is taking the lead in the nationwide August 3 Consumer Goods Production Movement. 
					
					 Thousands of housewives' workteams and sideline workteams are active in industrial establishments, co-op farms and residential quarters, and the number of home workers for welfare service has been increased in the city.  
					
					 Phyongchon, Taedonggang, Mangyongdae and Hyongjesan districts produce varieties of consumer goods by making an effective use of inner resources. 
					
					 As a result, ready-made clothes, electrical appliances, grassworks, craftworks, plastic goods, utensils and other consumer goods have grown in both variety and quality compared with last year.
					
					Some time ago, Pyongyang City held an exhibition of August 3 consumer goods in the Three-revolution Exhibition, drawing more than 80,000 goods of over 890 kinds.
					
					 Ko In Sil, a department director of the Pyongyang City People's Committee, told KCNA that the August 3 Consumer Goods Production Movement can prove successful only when the masses' wisdom and creative effort are pooled and all inner resources and potentials tapped.

articles.title: Fishermen's Meeting Held
articles.content:
Fishermen's Meeting Held
						

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- Officials in the field of fishery and employees of the Bureau for the Management of Pelagic Fishing held a meeting at the Sinpho Fishery Station Friday before going out for pelagic fishing this year.
					
					 The reporter and speakers at the meeting renewed their resolution to conduct pelagic fishing this year in a bold and big manner to boost the fish haul for people. 
					
					 They said they would conduct dynamic fishing operations and boost the fish catch to the maximum by keeping scientific fish shoal detecting ahead of netting and successfully ensuring the coordinated operations among fishing boats to suit fishing grounds.
					
					 They vowed to return home with big fish haul flags flying from deep seas and thus contribute to the building of a rich and powerful country.
					
					 Then fishing boats left the port.

articles.title: Chicken-made Health Dishes
articles.content:
Chicken-made Health Dishes
						

					Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- The Korean people, from olden times, have cooked various kinds of health dishes with chicken in summer.
					
					 The director of the Folklore Institute under the Academy of Social Sciences, Kong Myong Song, told KCNA the cooking methods differ from locality to locality. What is a usual method is to steam a medium-sized hen with seasoning or sliced garlic in its stomach. There is a saying, "If one takes three chickens steamed with garlic in summertime, he or she will never catch cold in winter."
					
					 Chicken soup mixed with insam (ginseng) is another kind of health food in summer. 
					
					Chicken boiled without seasoning, stuffed with glutinous rice, insam and forest asiabell, stimulates appetite in hot days. It is also efficacious for diseases.
					
					 Chicken-made dishes are popular in restaurants of Korea in the summer days.

articles.title: Decision of Joint Conference over Sundry Goods Production
articles.content:
Decision of Joint Conference over Sundry Goods Production 
						

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung devoted his whole life to the happiness of the people.
					
					 In January Juche 66 (1977) he presided over a joint conference of the Political Committee of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), Central People's Committee and Administration Council.
					
					 A senior official from the State Planning Commission suggested having a list of sundry goods ordered adopted without a detailed explanation because the President had examined it more than once before and officials concerned had well known about it.
					
					 But the President said the sundry goods production was one of the most important things for people's living and asked him to slowly read the list without omitting even an item.
					
					 The 206-item list included even spoon, chopsticks, fine-toothed bamboo comb, vase and needle.
					
					 When the official was reading the list, the President wrote down the items in his handbook.
					
					 When he finished reading, the President rose from his seat.
					
					 Saying the production of sundry goods was one of the tasks set by WPK, he suggested deciding on the list for the new year by a show of hands and raised his right hand first.
					
					 He then said the implementation of the decision would be judged by the people.

articles.title: KCNA Blasts Japan's Claim to Tok Islets
articles.content:
KCNA Blasts Japan's Claim to Tok Islets

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- The Japan Defence Ministry published a white paper in which the Tok Islets are described as part of Japan's territory at a Cabinet meeting on Tuesday. 
					
					 This is a wanton violation of the dignity and sovereignty of the Korean nation.
					
					 The islets are part of the inviolable territory of Korea as they have been ruled by Koreans throughout their long history after they came into their possession. 
					
					 This fact has been clearly proved not only by state documents of Korea and its historical data but by historical materials of Japan. In January of 1696 the Edo Government of Japan recognized the fact that Ullung Island and Tok Islets belonged to Korea and issued an instruction banning Japanese' entry into waters off Ullung Island.  On March 20, 1877 Tomomi Iwakura of the Taiseikan, the then supreme mechanism of the Japanese government, issued an instruction to the Ministry of Home Affairs informing it that the above-said island and islets had nothing to do with Japan. These facts also go to prove that Tok Islets have not been part of the territory of Japan from a historical viewpoint. 
					
					 Explicitly speaking, the islets are not the territory to be disputed because of ambiguous ownership.
					
					 Nevertheless, the Japanese reactionaries are persistently claiming that they are part of the territory of Japan. This once again clearly proves that they are the impudent guys who stoop to any infamy to realize their ambition for territorial expansion. 
					
					 Clear is the aim sought by them in raising a claim to the islets so persistently and shamelessly. They seek to deliberately build up public opinion supportive of their claim and internationalize the issue in a bid to spark the territorial dispute and create conditions and environment for staging a comeback to Korea.  
					
					 Japan openly described the islets as its territory not only in its diplomatic blue paper but in history textbooks, maps and other books for the education of young Japanese which have been distributed inside and outside it. Not content with this, It let dozens of Japanese shift their domicile of origin to the islets this year. Those who claim to be Dietmen attempted to visit Ullung Island. All these are part of their moves. 
					
					 Japan's claim to Tok Islets is aimed to convince its people that the islets are part of its territory in a bid to prepare them to be ready for a future war for territorial expansion, ie aggression of Korea. It is nothing but a crafty artifice to float story about Japan's dominion over the islets in the international community and legalize and justify its moves for grabbing the islets. 
					
					 Japan is making far-fetched assertion that the inviolable territory of other country belongs to its territory. This is a reckless act which can be committed only by the Japanese reactionaries steeped in the wild ambition for overseas expansion to the marrow of their bones. 
					
					 Neither concession nor compromise is allowed over a territorial issue. 
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will never tolerate any moves of Japan to grab the islets. 
					
					There can never be Japan's dominion over the islets.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls on Everybody to Live Worthwhile Life to Recollect Today with Pride
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls on Everybody to Live Worthwhile Life to Recollect Today with Prid

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- Everybody should lead a worthwhile life to recollect today with pride before the era, history and descendants just like the heroes of the drama "We Will Recollect Today".
					
					 DPRK Papers Friday say this editorially.
					
					 It is the philosophical principle taught by the drama that only those strong in faith and will can overcome heartbreaking sacrifices on the road of following the leader and defending the country and weather any trials, editorials note.
					
					 When all the people add shine to their everyday life to contribute to the building of a rich and powerful country, taking the noble spiritual world of the heroes of the drama as a model, can our country make a steady dynamic advance towards a bright future racing against the time, Rodong Sinmun notes, and goes on:
					
					 The heroes of the drama and the recollection of the unforgettable Arduous March, the forced march are encouraging all the servicepersons and people in their heroic struggle.
					
					 Genuine patriotism and devoted service for future should find their manifestation in devotedly implementing Party's policies.
					
					 Everybody should live and struggle with the will to honor the pledge made before the Party at any cost and the desire to be roots supporting the country no matter what and where he or she is doing and the spirit of boundless devotion to carve out future, counting every second and minute.
					
					 Everybody is required to maximize the speed of the on-going advance for a great surge the way the soldiers do, taking the revolutionary soldier spirit as a treasured sword for winning one victory after another. 
					
					 Minju Joson stresses that the drama serves as a good textbook instilling revolutionary views on life and future into the servicepersons and people of the DPRK.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Feats of Kim Jong Il for Independent National Reunification
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Feats of Kim Jong Il for Independent National Reunification
						

					Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Friday dedicates a bylined article to the 14th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification."
					
					 In the work Kim Jong Il formulated the three principles of national reunification--independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity--, the 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo, embodiment of President Kim Il Sung's idea of national reunification, as the three charters for Korea's reunification, thus providing the Korean nation with guidelines to be adhered to in the cause of national reunification.
					
					 The publication of the work made it possible for the Koreans to conduct more vigorously the struggle for accelerating the national reunification under the President's idea and line, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The Koreans' struggle for great national unity and reunification has developed into a nationwide movement comprising all the people in the north and the south and overseas. This led to the adoption of the June 15 joint declaration, full embodiment of the three charters for national reunification, and the October 4 declaration, its action programme, and eye-opening events unprecedented in the development of inter-Korean relations and the national reunification movement.
					
					 The achievements made in the June 15 era of reunification are a striking demonstration of the work's validity and vitality. This instilled into the Koreans the firm conviction that the cause of independent reunification is sure to be realized when all of them get united in struggle.
					
					 All Koreans at home and abroad should get closely united under the banner of great national unity and strengthen the driving forces for reunification in every way. When they achieve great unity, it is quite possible to tide over any difficulties and accomplish the cause of national reunification.

articles.title: US Forces' Burial of Defoliant Slammed in S. Korea
articles.content:
US Forces' Burial of Defoliant Slammed in S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- Hwang Son, chief of the strike group for peace in south Korea, condemned the hair-raising burial of defoliant by the U.S. imperialist aggression forces in south Korea.
					
					 In an interview with Internet paper Jaju Minbo on July 30 Hwang noted that the group was formed on July 26 to probe the truth about the U.S. forces' burial of defoliant and has since staged a protest strike outside the U.S. military base in Waegwan.
					
					 The U.S. forces' burial of defoliant fundamentally revealed south Korea's humiliating relations with the U.S., Hwang stated, and went on:
					
					 The fact that people's existence and life are decided by foreign troops clearly shows south Korea is a colony of the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. and south Korean authorities are busy evading a proper probe into the truth of the defoliant burial and concealing the case. It is hard to probe the truth in the society where a thief raises a hue and cry, so it will be probed by popular masses as was done when the "Cheonan" warship sinking case occurred.
					
					 The defoliant issue is not pertinent only to the inhabitants in Waegwan. To put an end to the unequal relations with the U.S. is an important matter anyone should not turn aside.

articles.title: S. Korea: Religionists Stand against Construction of Jeju Naval Base
articles.content:
S. Korea: Religionists Stand against Construction of Jeju Naval Base
						

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- Bishops of Catholicism in south Korea have staged actions against the puppet authorities' construction of naval base in Kangjong Village, Sogwipho City, Jeju Island.
					
					 Ok Hyon Jin, bishop of the Catholic Parish of Kwangju, in a lecture on peace on Monday said that intolerable is the authorities' violent crackdown on the action of the Kangjong villagers to defend their cradle of their life.
					
					 Urging the authorities to stop at once the illegal and unilateral project, the bishop declared that the parish would vigorously cope with the developments in Jeju Island in solidarity with the villagers and the Catholic Parish of Jeju.
					
					 Meanwhile, bishops in different areas of south Korea expressed their stand to continue to lay bare the unreasonable construction of the Jeju naval base.

articles.title: British Company Denounces S. Korean "Government" for Unreasonable Decision
articles.content:
British Company Denounces S. Korea for Unreasonable Decision

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities cut off access to the Internet homepage of the Koryo Tours Company, according to VOA. 
					
					 The travel company, established by a British in Beijing, has introduced tourist souvenirs, photos, books and films of the DPRK to western Europeans since 1993.  
					
					 The company announced on August 1 that its website has been filtered by the south Korean "government" from the outset of this year. 
					
					 The south Korean intelligence service applied the "Security Law" to the website, describing some of its contents as for pro-DPRK propaganda purpose.
					
					 As a result, south Korean people have been denied access to "www.koryogroup.com" or "www.koryotours.com" from the beginning of the year. 
					
					 The company said it had sought to promote understanding between the DPRK and outside world, and termed the decision of the south Korean "government" unreasonable.

articles.title: Songun Policy Praised by Mexican Personages
articles.content:
Songun Policy Praised by Mexican Personages

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- A lecture was given in Mexico on July 29 to mark the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					The coordinator of San Luis Potosi State Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico and the chairman of the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism said in their speeches that General Secretary Kim Jong Il developed in depth the Songun idea founded by President Kim Il Sung and enforced the Songun policy, the original political mode, the first of its kind in history.
					
					 They profoundly explained the essence, validity and vitality of the Songun policy in combination with the reality of the DPRK, adding that the Songun policy is just and the most effective political mode and an all-powerful treasured sword defending the sovereignty of the country and nation and guaranteeing the victorious advance of the human cause of independence. 
					
					 They praised the army and people of the DPRK for having achieved miraculous successes and progress in all fields including politics, military affairs, economy and culture by resolutely foiling the imperialists' moves to stifle the DPRK under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il for more than half a century. They also lauded them for dynamically speeding up the on-going all-out offensive to bring about a decisive turn in the building of a thriving nation.
					
					 They renewed their resolution to intensify their activities for studying and disseminating the Juche idea, the Songun idea in order to commemorate the centenary of birth of the President as a great jubilee in human history.

articles.title: Korean People's Struggle Supported by Foreign Parties and Organizations
articles.content:
Korean People's Struggle Supported by Foreign Parties and Organizations

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea released a joint statement on July 26 to mark the 58th anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 July 27 is a victory day not only for the Korean people but for the world progressive people, it noted, and went on: The Korean people defeated U.S. imperialism and won a brilliant victory in the war under the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 This put great spurs to the national liberation struggle and revolutionary movement in the world and started U.S. imperialism on the downgrade. 
					
					 The Korean People's Army has grown incomparably stronger than what it used to be in the 1950s under the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Communist Party of the People and the Organization of Young Communists of Spain said in a joint statement on July 27: The war is not over on the Korean Peninsula and the imperialists' provocations and threats to the DPRK are going on.
					
					 It extended unequivocal support and solidarity to the Korean people in their drive to build a thriving socialist nation.

articles.title: War Victory Day of Korean People Marked in Different Countries
articles.content:
War Victory Day of Korean People Marked in Different Countries

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- Various events took place in different countries on the 58th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War. They included meetings, photo exhibitions and film shows in UK, Benin, Indonesia and Malaysia between July 22 and 30.
					
					 Displayed in the venues of the photo exhibitions were photos of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il inspecting units of the Korean People's Army and providing field guidance to the work in different domains of the national economy and photos on the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War and their efforts to build a thriving nation.
					
					 Participants of film shows watched "Matchless Ranks of Paraders" and other Korean films.
					
					 Harpal Brar, chairman of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist), said the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War was the victory not only of the party, army and people of the DPRK but of the world revolutionary people.
					
					 It is thanks to Kim Jong Il identical to Kim Il Sung in his iron-willed grit, pluck and commanding art that the DPRK had access to powerful nuclear deterrent and is demonstrating before the world its might as an invincible socialist power leading the U.S. by the nose, said Keith Bennet, deputy director-general of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea.
					
					 Hessou Kohovi, chairman of the Benin-Korea Amicable Association "Long Live Kim Jong Il, Supreme Leader", and the secretary general of the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and of General Kim Jong Il's Works highly praised Kim Il Sung for performing undying feats in winning the victory in the war, expressing belief that the DPRK would always emerge victorious as it is led by Kim Jong Il and has powerful capability for self-defence.

articles.title: Highest Radiation Measured at Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant
articles.content:
Highest Radiation Measured at Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- More than 10Sv radiation per hour was recently measured in the lower part of outside exhaust pipe between Reactors Nos. 1 and 2 of the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant of Japan.
					
					 It was reported that this was all-time high.
					
					 Tokyo Electric Power Co. quoted survey data as saying this on August 1.

articles.title: Many Japanese Unaware of Mar. 11 Earthquake
articles.content:
Many Japanese Unaware of Mar. 11 Earthquake
						

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- As already reported, Japan met with the March 11 earthquake and tsunami that devastated a wide area with Tohoku as the center. 
					
					 But many Japanese people in all prefectures were not aware of the devastating earthquake at that time.
					
					 It was revealed by a special survey organ of Japan on July 31.

articles.title: Background against which Tragedy of Bloodshed Took Place in Norway
articles.content:
Background against which Tragedy of Bloodshed Took Place in Norway
						

					Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- An Ultra-Right element carried out a bomb attack and shooting spree in Norway recently, leaving 77 people dead and dozens of others wounded.
					
					 They were shocking tragedies that stunned Europe in the wake of the bomb attack in Madrid in 2004 and the subway bomb attack in London in 2005.
					
					 The incidents unprecedented in the history of peaceful Norway are a wake-up call to the international community that ultra-right forces have been revived in Europe to seriously challenge the social order on the continent.
					
					 The man suspected of the recent shooting spree is a typical ultra-right element styling himself a "conservative Norwegian". In the past he did not hide his extremist stand and categorically opposed the idea that various cultures can coexist.
					
					 His hooliganism tells the world that it is an urgent task for the European countries to hold in check the spread of the ultra-right idea and, at the same time, achieve social stability irrespective of political view, religious faith and culture.
					
					After the end of World War II, the state control over Nazism considerably weakened the ultra-right forces in Europe and there was an exodus of immigrants to the West Europe which was short of manpower from Mideast and African countries. With the flow of time social integration presented itself as a headache due to the wide gap among various ethnic groups in culture and lifestyle.
					
					 Recent economic depression in Europe injected fresh energy into the ultra-right forces. The European economy is hit hard by global financial crisis and debt crisis, increasing the joblessness and sparking off Xenophobia among some people.
					
					 Ultra-right forces became vocal in the political forces in European countries including Denmark, Netherlands, Finland, France, Germany and Austria.
					
					 Such ultra-right organizations as "Skin heads" and "self-styling nationalists" have frequently appeared on streets, vandalizing real estates and staging violent demonstrations. These posed a threat to the living of the people at large.
					
					 More than 20,000 cases of crimes committed by those elements were reported in Germany in 2008.
					
					 Such ultra-right trend also affected the political order in Europe. Some ultra-right political parties took parliamentary seats and even some of them held important government posts, influencing states to adjust policies in such a manner as to control cultural leniency.
					
					 The tragedy of bloodshed in Norway warned the whole Europe that such ultra-right trend has gone beyond the limit, letting extremism do harm to the life of the people and the society.
					
					 The international community should draw a lesson from the shocking bloodshed committed against the peaceable inhabitants of Norway and heighten vigilance against the revival of ultra-right forces.

articles.title: Worldwide Attention Focuses on Six-Party Talks
articles.content:
Worldwide Attention Focuses on Six-Party Talks

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- Worldwide attention has focused on the six-party talks for peace and denuclearization of the Korean peninsula.
					
					 Early Reopening of Six-party Talks Is Universal Desire 
					
					 The Chinese People's Daily on July 24 said the north and south of Korea have drawn close attention for their latest announcement of position on the six-party talks.
					
					 According to south Korea's Yonhap News, Ri Yong Ho and Wi Song Rak, heads of the north and south delegations to the six-party talks, had talks at the International Conference Centre in Bali, Indonesia, on the afternoon of July 22 and agreed to make joint efforts for an early reopening of the six-party talks, the daily said, adding:
					
					 Chinese Foreign Minister Yang Jiechi said China welcomes efforts made by each party concerned to promote dialogue, and negotiations between the north and south of Korea. 
					
					 China is ready to promote an early reopening of the six-party talks by keeping close communication and accommodation, widening speculation and pooling wisdom with other sides and the international community, he noted. This is a universal desire of the international community.
					
					 Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on July 22 that the six-party talks are likely to be resumed at an early date. 
					
					 Speaking to reporters after a meeting of foreign ministers of the east Asia summit nations, Lavrov said the participants in the meeting reached a conclusion that the six-party talks system should not be changed, and that the latest development inspired people with the hope that the talks will be resumed at an early date.
					
					 The six-way talks are an agreed format, he said. All parties to the talks, including Russia, are making efforts to provide conditions necessary for the talks and have begun to work for implementing the already attained agreement concerning the denuclearization of the Korean peninsula.
					
					 Optimistic View of Talks
					
					 The Russian news agency ITAR-TASS said on July 24 that the six-party talks are likely to be reopened at an early date.
					
					 The recent development concerning the nuclear issue of the Korean peninsula serves as a good reason for Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov to make an optimistic remark as regards the talks, said the news agency.

articles.title: Chinese Army Units Required to Study Hu Jintao's Speech
articles.content:
Chinese Army Units Required to Study Hu Jintao's Speech
						

					 Beijing, August 4 (KCNA) -- The Central Military Commission of China recently issued a notice calling for deeply studying the speech delivered by General Secretary Hu Jintao at a meeting held to celebrate the 90th birthday of the Communist Party of China.
					
					 The notice called on all military units to meet the basic requirement to obey the party's command, cherish a steadfast faith in socialism with Chinese characteristics and adhere to the fundamentals and system of the party's absolute leadership over the army.

articles.title: Chinese Defense Minister Calls for Developing Militia
articles.content:
Chinese Defense Minister Calls for Developing Militia

					 Beijing, August 4 (KCNA) -- Liang Guanglie, Chinese defense minister and state councilor, called for promoting a successful and rapid development of the militia.
					
					 During a recent inspection tour of Jilin and Liaoning provinces, he said the organs at all levels should fully understand the main task to rapidly change the mode of enhancing the combat efficiency.

articles.title: China Takes Measures to Prevent Traffic Accidents
articles.content:
China Takes Measures to Prevent Traffic Accidents

					 Beijing, August 4 (KCNA) -- The Chinese Ministry of Transport recently issued an emergency notice calling for controlling large-scale traffic accidents.
					
					 The notice urges senior officials to lead inspection teams to make surveys of incidents and their factors.

articles.title: China Combats Copyright Infringements, Fake Goods
articles.content:
China Combats Copyright Infringements, Fake Goods 

					 Beijing, August 4 (KCNA) -- China conducted special activities to combat copyright infringements and production and sale of fake and low-quality goods from October last year to June this year.
					
					During the activities, 4,966 production and selling bases of fake and low-quality goods were eliminated and 1,745 business licenses confiscated.

articles.title: China Cooperates with Other Countries
articles.content:
China Cooperates with Other Countries
						

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- China and Mongolia signed a coal deal on July 29.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Free Trade Agreement between China and Costa Rica reportedly entered into force on Aug. 1.

articles.title: Russia Opposes US MD Deployment in Coastal Area of Black Sea
articles.content:
Russia Opposes US MD Deployment in Coastal Area of Black Sea

					 Moscow, August 4 (KCNA) -- Dmitri Rogozin, Russian permanent representative to NATO, in a recent press conference clarified the stand of Russia opposing the deployment of the U.S. missile defense system in coastal area of the Black Sea.
					
					 Russia is opposed to the U.S. MD deployment in coastal area of the Black Sea though components of its system do not go against the interests of Russia, he said.
					
					 There is no justification to deploy weapons in this area, he said, adding: If warships of those countries which have nothing to do with the area are amassing on the Black Sea under the pretext of building the MD, this can not but go against the grain with Russia, he added.

articles.title: Mongolia Rejects Plan of Spent Nuclear Fuel Disposal Facilities
articles.content:
Mongolia Rejects Plan of Spent Nuclear Fuel Disposal Facilities

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- Two Mongolian civic organizations strongly rejected the plan of the U.S. and Japan to build spent nuclear fuel disposal facilities, according to the Japanese newspaper Mainichi Shimbun July 31. 
					
					 The organizations embracing more than 2,000 people have launched a campaign against the plan through Facebook.
					
					 The request made out by the organizations expressed surprise and resentment at the plan and strongly urged the Japanese prime minister to cancel it.

articles.title: Raul Castro Refers to Economic Development
articles.content:
Raul Castro Refers to Economic Development
						

					 Havana, August 4 (KCNA) -- Raul Castro, president of the Council of State and president of the Council of Ministers of Cuba, referred to the issue of the country's economic development, speaking at the 7th session of the 7th National Assembly of People's Power of Cuba on August 1.
					
					 In order to implement the social and economic policy and line of the party and the revolution it is necessary to minutely guide the work and improve the ability of the officials, he said.
					
					 He underlined the need to strengthen the financial discipline in the economic field and root out the style of working in a hit-or-miss manner.

articles.title: Hezbollah Slams Israel's Attack on Lebanese Army
articles.content:
Hezbollah Slams Israel's Attack on Lebanese Army
						

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- Lebanese Shiite armed group Hezbollah issued a statement on Monday slamming the attack made by the Israeli army on Lebanese army units along the two countries' border areas earlier in the day.
					
					 "The Israeli enemy attacked the Lebanese army units in the Wazzani area and opened fire on them in a provocative and surprising way," the statement said. It added that this crime is a reminder for the Lebanese people of the aggressive nature of the Zionist enemy.
					
					 The army and people of Lebanon will resolutely beat back any military attack of the enemy, it stressed.

articles.title: Israel Condemned for Killing Palestinians
articles.content:
Israel Condemned for Killing Palestinians 

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Palestinian National Authority (PNA) condemned the Israeli forces for the killing of Palestinians on Monday.  
					
					 Israeli troops raided a refugee camp in the West Bank and shot dead two Palestinians early in the morning.
					
					 "This is an Israeli attempt to create an atmosphere of escalation before September," said the spokesman, referring to the month in which the Palestinians will ask the United Nations to vote on their state. 
					
					 He strongly urged the Israeli authorities to stop killing Palestinians at once.

articles.title: PNA Condemns Israeli Killings
articles.content:
PNA Condemns Israeli Killings
						

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the chief of the Palestinian National Authority on Monday condemned the Israeli army for killing Palestinians.
					
					 That day Israeli troops killed two innocent Palestinians at a refugee's camp in the West Bank.
					
					 This is an Israeli attempt to create an atmosphere of escalating tension before September when the PNA will submit a written request on recognizing the independent state to the UN General Assembly, the spokesman said.
					
					 He strongly demanded the Israeli authorities stop at once the killings of Palestinians.

articles.title: Iran Criticizes West's Attitude toward Terrorism
articles.content:
Iran Criticizes West's Attitude toward Terrorism
						

					Tehran, August 4 (KCNA) -- The Iranian Foreign Ministry spokesman Tuesday accused the West of taking a wrong attitude towards the terrorism issue.
					
					 Speaking to reporters, he exposed the West's sheltering terrorist organizations, and said Western nations should not protect terrorists but punish them.
					
					 If terrorist acts are prevalent all over the world, terrorists will aim at not only specific regions but also countries which supported them, the spokesman said. The West should show their sincerity in the anti-terrorism battle.

articles.title: India, Pakistan Take Stride Forward in Relations
articles.content:
India, Pakistan Take Stride Forward in Relations
						

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- Talks between foreign ministers of India and Pakistan were held in New Delhi at the end of July.
					
					 Their meeting, the first of its kind in a year, yielded some results.
					
					 The joint statement, released after the talks, unveiled Kashmir-related confidence building measures.
					
					 Travels across the divided Kashmir will now include visits for tourism and religious pilgrimage, while earlier the bus service was only for families that separated after the 1947 war on Kashmir.
					
					 The two sides also decided to relax travel permit conditions by having a six-month multiple entry, extended from four weeks. The number of trading days will extend from two to four days per week.
					
					 They also agreed to continue the talks over the issues of expanding export items and establishing a system of confidence building over the nuclear issue.
					
					 As regards the agreement, news media are of the view that the two countries have entered a new stage of peace talks.
					
					 The bilateral relations are historically complicated.
					
					 When the two countries won independence separately in 1947, they failed to reach an agreement on the Kashmir issue. Two of the three wars fought by the two countries were entirely related to Kashmir. In the hope of settling the Kashmir issue the two sides started all-round peace talks in 2004. But, in the wake of the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks, the peace talks had been suspended.
					
					 At the latest talks, the Pakistani foreign minister said the bilateral relations have come into a new era.
					
					 After the meeting, the Indian foreign minister said he was satisfied with the progress achieved in the round of the resumed dialogue and the outcomes have been with their expectations.
					
					 In a joint statement, both sides did not touch on the Mumbai terrorist incident, but underscored the need to seek a peaceful settlement by narrowing difference in opinion and establishing a common view.
					
					 This is an expression of the willingness common to both countries to make a bigger stride in peace talks.

articles.title: Shooting Kills One near Concert in US
articles.content:
Shooting Kills One near Concert in US 

					Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- Shooting occurred in Cleveland, Ohio State, the U.S. on July 30, causing social confusion.
					
					 An unidentified criminal jumped into the concert and opened fire, leaving one person dead and three wounded.

articles.title: US Drone Kills More Pakistanis
articles.content:
US Drone Kills More Pakistanis 

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- The U.S. troops in Afghanistan are killing more Pakistanis under the signboard of "anti-terrorism".
					
					 A U.S. drone fired missiles into Pakistan's South Waziristan tribal region on Monday, killing at least eight civilians and wounding two others.
					
					 Such atrocity is lashing local inhabitants into fury.

articles.title: Eurozone Unemployment Rate
articles.content:
Eurozone Unemployment Rate 
						

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- Eurostat estimated on August 1 that the number of the jobless is 22.473 million men and women in the EU.

articles.title: Vehicle Sales Down in Japan, France
articles.content:
Vehicle Sales Down in Japan, France

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- New vehicle sales in Japan fell 27.6 percent in July from a year earlier, according to the Japan Automobile Dealers Association on August 1.
					
					 Sales of new cars in France lost ground for the fourth successive month in July with a 5.9-percent drop.
					
					 The management of vehicle producers got serious due to the drop of the sales.

articles.title: Drug Smuggling Rampant in Japan
articles.content:
Drug Smuggling Rampant in Japan
						

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- Drug smuggling is rampant in Japan, sparking great furor in society.
					
					 Customs officials at Narita airport seized a total of 119 kilograms of illegal stimulants in the first half of this year and a total of 70 people were arrested for smuggling illegal drugs, Tokyo Customs said Monday.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits Papua New Guinea, Vanuatu, Japan
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits Papua New Guinea, Vanuatu, Japan
						

					 Pyongyang, August 5 (KCNA) -- A 6.8-magnitude earthquake hit Papua New Guinea on July 31. The epicenter was in its northern waters.
					
					 A 6.0-magnitude quake jolted Vanuatu on the same day. The epicenter was in northeastern waters.
					
					 Meanwhile, a 6.1-magnitude earthquake jolted Shizuoka Prefecture, Japan on August 1. The epicenter was 20 km deep in the waters of Suruga Bay.
					
					 A 5.7-magnitude quake hit Iwate Prefecture that day.

articles.title: Natural Disasters in China
articles.content:
Natural Disasters in China
						

					 Beijing, August 4 (KCNA) -- Hails, strong wind and thunder and other natural disasters hit China in July, causing damage.
					
					 According to the office of the State Disaster Reduction Committee, 97 people were killed, 16,000 dwelling houses collapsed and 158,000 houses destroyed in Beijing, 27 provinces, autonomous regions and municipalities during the period.
					
					 The disasters afflicted a total of 20,165,000 people and caused economic losses amounting to 13.28 billion RMB. Y. 
					
					 Steps are now being taken to eradicate the aftermath of disasters.

articles.title: CRPP rechaza fabricación del "caso de grupo de espías" en Sur de Corea
articles.content:
CRPP rechaza fabricación del "caso de grupo de espías" en Sur de Corea
						

					Pyongyang, 5 de agosto (ACNC) -- El Secretariado del Comité por la Reunificación Pacífica de la Patria hizo pública el día 4 la información no. 977 denunciando a las autoridades de seguridad pública del Sur de Corea que fabricaron el "caso del grupo de espías". 
					
					El texto completo del documento sigue: 
					
					Las autoridades fascistas de seguridad pública del Sur de Corea, incluso el Servicio Nacional de Inteligencia y la fiscalía, levantan ahora la ola de represión contra las personalidades patrióticas pro-reunificación de distintos sectores tras inventar el intrigante "caso del grupo de espías". 
					
					Investigan injustamente a los políticos de oposición y a las personalidades de círculos sindical, académico, económico, etc. pretextando que ellos sostuvieron algún "contacto" ilícito y hay "pruebas materiales", y pretenden ejecutarlos salvajemente. 
					
					El Secretariado del CRPP denuncia categóricamente esa campaña de represión calificándola de embestida fascista contra las fuerzas patrióticas pro-reunificación del Sur de Corea y de otra grave provocación contra la República Popular Democrática de Corea. 
					
					El "caso del grupo de espías" es una farsa de punta a cabo. 
					
					Las "pruebas", presentadas por las autoridades de seguridad pública, fueron publicadas ya por los medios surcoreanos de prensa y en Internet. Y la "lista", de que hablan ellas, es otro invento sumamente absurdo. 
					
					Ellas han sido ridiculizadas por la gente por haber cambiado a su conveniencia el nombre que han puesto inicialmente ellas mismas a una supuesta "organización clandestina". 
					
					Siempre que se encuentran en la crisis de dominación, los títeres surcoreanos usan el método rutinario de inventar el "caso del grupo de espías".
					
					Ahora el Sur de Corea está a punto de derrumbe debido a la asquerosa política vendepatria y servil a grandes potencias, las maniobras fratricidas, las políticas antipopulares y la corrupción de la banda de títeres surcoreanos que son odiados tanto por la población surcoreana. 
					
					Los habitantes surcoreanos de distintos sectores despliegan una dinámica lucha anti-"gubernamental" por sentenciar severamente a esa camarilla en las elecciones de diputados a la "Asamblea Nacional" y en las elecciones presidenciales del año próximo. 
					
					Al inventar ese caso sensacional, las autoridades de seguridad pública pretenden apaciguar el ánimo antigubernamental de amplias masas por el fracaso total de la política interior y exterior y de las relaciones Norte-Sur, distraer la atención de la opinión pública, suprimir las actividades de las fuerzas progresistas acusándolas de "procomunistas" y  "pro-norteñas", y a la larga, lograr la retoma del poder de las fuerzas conservadoras al salir de la crisis actual. 
					
					En particular, quieren enfriar la opinión pública que demanda la mejora de relaciones íntercoreanas y el cambio de la "política sobre el Norte" y mantener la política de confrontación fratricida. 
					
					Por eso, los partidos opositores y los habitantes surcoreanos denuncian el presente caso como "complot sucio para exterminar a las fuerzas progresistas" y "ganar las elecciones generales y presidenciales del año próximo".
					
					A través del presente caso, se ha revelado más claramente la naturaleza conflictiva y anti-reunificación de la banda de conservadores surcoreanos. 
					
					Estarían muy equivocadas las autoridades surcoreanas de seguridad si ellas piensan que podrían engañar la opinión pública y salir de la crisis de dominación con tal payasada. 
					
					Los últimos esfuerzos desesperados de ellas aumentan sólo las críticas y protestas de la opinión pública interna y externa. 
					
					Los conservadores surcoreanos deben parar ahora mismo su campaña de represión contra las personalidades patrióticas pro-reunificación.

articles.title: Para Japón es una ilusión vana la posesión del islote Tok, comenta ACNC
articles.content:
Para Japón es una ilusión vana la posesión del islote Tok, comenta ACNC
						

					Pyongyang, 5 de agosto (ACNC) -- El Ministerio de Defensa de Japón publicó el día 2 en la reunión del gabinete una carta blanca que anota el islote Tok como un territorio propio de Japón. 
					
					Esto es un crimen que viola brutalmente la dignidad y la soberanía de la nación coreana. 
					
					El islote Tok es el territorio inviolable de Corea junto con larga historia coreana. 
					
					Lo comprueban no sólo los archivos nacionales y los datos históricos de Corea, sino también los materiales históricos de  Japón. 
					
					  En enero de 1696 el gobierno de Edo de Japón reconoció que la isla Ullung y el islote Tok son territorios coreanos y dio la orden de prohibir la entrada de los japoneses en la zona marítima de la isla Ullung. Y el 20 de marzo de 1877, Tomomi Iwakura de Taiseikan, órgano supremo del gobierno japonés, dio al Ministerio del Interior la instrucción de que "Japón no tiene nada que ver con la Ullung y el Tok". Tales hechos comprueban que desde el punto de vista histórico el islote Tok no es una parte del territorio japonés. 
					
					  Ciertamente, el islote Tok no es un territorio conflictivo sin dueño evidente. 
					
					  Sin embargo, los reaccionarios japoneses insisten en su posesión del Tok, revelando por sí solos su naturaleza de cínicos que se valen de todos los medios para la expansión territorial. 
					
					  Su verdadera intención es provocar un conflicto internacionalizando ese problema y preparar las condiciones y el ambiente favorables para la nueva agresión a Corea. 
					
					  Para ese fin, anotan sin escrúpulos el islote Tok como un territorio japonés no sólo en la carta azul diplomática sino también en los manuales de historia, mapas y folletos. Además, este año decenas de japoneses decidieron trasladar al islote Tok el domicilio de origen y los parlamentarios tratan de entrar en la isla Ullung.
					
					  La insistencia de Japón en la posesión del islote Tok es una artimaña para inculcar entre los japoneses la compresión de que el islote Tok es el territorio japonés para que ellos puedan incorporarse a la guerra de expansión territorial, o sea, guerra de agresión a Corea, y al mismo tiempo, legalizar y justificar la usurpación del Tok difundiendo en la sociedad internacional el rumor de que el derecho a la posesión de ese islote está en Japón. 
					
					   Con respecto al territorio, no hay ninguna concesión ni una conciliación. 
					
					  El ejército y el pueblo de Corea no perdonarán jamás la usurpación del islote Tok por parte de Japón. 
					
					  Tanto en el pasado como en el presente y en el futuro es irrealizable el derecho a la posesión del islote Tok por Japón.

articles.title: Miembros de flotilla china rinden tributo a Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Miembros de flotilla china rinden tributo a Kim Il Sung 
						

					Pyongyang, 5 de agosto (ACNC) -- Los miembros de la flotilla de las fuerzas navales del Ejército Popular de Liberación de China (EPLCh) dirigida por el vicealmirante Tian Zhong, comandante de la Flota del Mar Norte del EPLCh depositaron el día 4 un cesto de flores en nombre de la flotilla ante la estatua de bronce del Presidente Kim Il Sung erguida en la ciudad de Wonsan de la provincia de Kangwon.
					
					  Los participantes rindieron homenaje al Presidente con el alma de respeto y veneración hacia él.

articles.title: Pyongyang aumenta producción de artículos de consumo popular
articles.content:
Pyongyang aumenta producción de artículos de consumo popular
						

					Pyongyang, 5 de agosto (ACNC) -- La ciudad de Pyongyang se encuentra en la delantera del movimiento por la producción de los artículos de consumo popular 3 de Agosto que se despliega masivamente a escala nacional.
					
					La ciudad organizó miles de equipos de amas de casa y de autoconsumo y otros que producen artículos de consumo en las fábricas, empresas, granjas agrícolas, barrios y unidades de vecinos y aumentó las filas de red de servicio público familiar.
					
					Los capitalinos municipios de Phyongchon, Taedonggang, Mangyongdae y Hyongjesan producen muchos artículos de consumo popular de diversas clases movilizando con eficacia las reservas internas.
					
					Se elevó la calidad de los productos, tales como ropas confeccionadas, utensilios eléctricos, productos de pajas, otros de artesanía,  productos de uso diario plásticos y bienes domésticos, y se multiplicaron sus variedades. 
					
					Se exhibieron en la exposición de artículos de consumo popular 3 de Agosto de la ciudad de Pyongyang que tuvo lugar hace unos días en la Exposición Permanente de las Tres Revoluciones más de 80 mil productos de más de 890 clases.
					
					Citada con el reportero de la Agencia Central de Noticias de Corea (ACNC), Ko In Sil, directora de departamento del Comité Popular de la Ciudad de Pyongyang, señaló que a través de la exhibición llegó a tener una convicción de que es posible producir cuanto quiera los artículos de consumo de gran popularidad si se apoya en la inteligencia y la creatividad de las masas populares y se movilizan todas las reservas y posibilidades.
